summary: If you missed all the messages Oblivion gave you for increasing your skill ranks, then this mod is for you. Whenever you reach the required level for a new rank (Apprentice, Adept, Expert, and Master) a unique message is displayed and the related perk is earned.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://blog.flamingtext.com/blog/2013/02/12/flamingtext_com_1360651472_1060092084.png[/img]
[b][color=#00BFFF]Now with messages for every skill, even Legendary ones!

[color=#d8d8d8]This mod also has a [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/13067/]Skyrim Special Edition version[/url].[/color][/color][/b][/center]

[font=Verdana][size=5][b][color=#00BFFF]Description[/color][/b][/size][/font]

Remember how Oblivion always gave you an interesting message when you reached level 25, 50, 75, and 100 in each skill? Well, now Skyrim does too!
Whenever you reach a new rank (Apprentice, Adept, Expert, and Master respectively) in any skill, you will be presented with a custom (and hopefully entertaining) message. If it's a magic skill or the lockpicking skill, you'll also get the associated perk for free (unless you're using the LITE version). This saves you wasting perk points on those perks like "Apprentice Destruction" that only halve the required Magicka for spells of that rank - unlike Oblivion, where you actually needed the required rank in order to cast the spell. An extra special reward is also presented to those dedicated players that reach 100 (Master rank) in all five magic schools.
[center]_____[/center]

And don't worry, this mod is retro-active - if you're already level 87 or something, you will automatically receive all appropriate messages the next time you level up that skill. If you're already level 100 (and thus can't level up again), you can simply type into the console the following two lines:
>> player.setav [skill] 99
>> player.incpcs [skill]
(Without the >> at the beginning, and replacing [skill] with your chosen skill. Note that Archery is actually "Marksman" and Speech is actually "Speechcraft" in the console.)
This will advance you to level 100 in [skill] and you'll receive all the messages.

[font=Verdana][size=3][b][color=#00BFFF]Installation[/color][/b][/size][/font]

Simple. I'm sure you've done it before. Just choose a version and copy the contents of the folder into Skyrim's Data folder, and select the mod in the launcher the next time you play the game.
Alternatively, you could just install it with Nexus Mod Manager.

[font=Verdana][size=3][b][color=#00BFFF]Other Notes[/color][/b][/size][/font]

- [b]SKSE ([url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]http://skse.silverlock.org/[/url]) is highly recommended[/b] as of v3.0, since you won't receive special Master-rank messages on Legendary skills without it.
- [b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/3863/?]SkyUI 3.0 or later[/url] is highly recommended[/b] - this mod includes an MCM configuration menu (though it's more of a rank-viewing menu). The mod will function without it, but you won't be able to change to the LITE version without using the console. The console command to do so is "set JulesRankPerksUseLITE to 1" to enable LITE mode or "to 0" to disable it. But you won't need to know that unless you're crazy enough to play Skyrim without SkyUI.
- See how many references you can find to other franchises! References include [i]The Secret of Monkey Island, A Game of Thrones, Monty Python, TES IV: Oblivion, The Witcher 2, Robin Hood, Ghost in the Shell, Iron Man, Assassinâ€™s Creed, Conan the Barbarian, Lord of the Rings, The Lion King,[/i] and [i]The Matrix[/i].
- This now adds a decent amount of text to the game (just shy of 4,000 words), so if you find any spelling or grammatical errors in any of the messages, please let me know! I strive to have perfect English on everything that appears in-game, because it really breaks immersion for me if it's not.
- On the subject of grammatical errors... Though I am a proud advocate of British English, I know that Skyrim is made in America and uses American English. And I wanted my mod to fit into the vanilla game as seamlessly as possible, so against my personal inclination I have opted to use American English for this mod. So let me know if I slipped up anywhere. (The only real difference is "armor" instead of "armour".)
- If you receive the Arcane Mastery Perk (for getting to Master rank in all 5 magic schools) and then make one of those skills Legendary, you'll still keep that perk. You earned it.

[font=Verdana][size=3][b][color=#00BFFF]Version History[/color][/b][/size][/font]

Click on the "Changes" tab above.

[font=Verdana][size=3][b][color=#00BFFF]Credits[/color][/b][/size][/font]

Thanks to MrINBN for contributing to the Master Smithing message, and nvsblmnc for a Two-handed message.
And also thanks to the kind people of the forums who helped out with the initial script.
The title is generated by [url=http://www.flamingtext.com/]FlamingText.com[/url] (which is, in turn, powered by [url=http://www.gimp.org/]GIMP[/url]).
A begrudging thanks to the people that made me put in the extra work for a SkyRe version. It's nice to branch out.

[font=Verdana][size=3][b][color=#00BFFF]Compatibility Notes[/color][/b][/size][/font]

- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/9286/?]SkyRe (Skyrim Redone)[/url] - I do not use SkyRe myself, but I've made a version of this mod for SkyRe users. Lucky you. Obviously it requires SkyRe and its dependencies (including Dawnguard and Dragonborn).
- Official Skyrim patch 1.9 - with the new ability to make skills "Legendary", you will (as of v3.0) receive the same Apprentice/Adept/Expert messages for leveling up Legendary skills, but a new message for achieving Master rank.
- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1175/?]Community Uncapper[/url] mod (or any similar uncapper mod) - you'll get a special message at level 200 for achieving "legendary" mastery, same as if you'd made the skill legendary and re-leveled it to 100. I realise it's probably much harder to get to level 200 than from 15 to 100 twice, but... tough it out.

[font=Verdana][size=3][b][color=#00BFFF]Other Mods[/color][/b][/size][/font]

Also, feel free to check out my other mods:
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27873/]Dawnfang and Duskfang - Fully Functional[/url]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/17829/]Disenchant God Amulets WITH Talos Fix[/url]
author: Jules

files.name: Exciting Skill Ranks v1_1
files.changelogHtml:
Added the compiled script to the archive
Changed the script to use Message objects instead of debug messages
A few minor changes to the messages themselves to enhance clarity

files.name: Exciting Skill Ranks v1_2
files.changelogHtml:
Rewrote all the code to be independent of vanilla perks, paving the way for unique messages for other skills!
As a result, if you load up the mod with a high level in a magic school and most of the rank perks already, you will now receive all messages leading up to your rank (instead of seeing only the latest one)
The code is also much more elegant and stable, and doesn't give messages out of order anymore (if you receive a whole lot of messages at once, eg when you've just activated the mod)
Removed the requirement of having the Novice perk - if you reach level 25 and don't have it, you'll receive both the Novice and Apprentice rank perks

files.name: Exciting Skill Ranks v1_3
files.changelogHtml:
Now with MCM support, courtesy of SkyUI 3.0!
Toggle between LITE mode and standard mode in the mod configuration menu
See all of your skill ranks (which may or not be in sync with your current skills) in the mod configuration menu
LITE mode has had all the messages rewritten AGAIN, and this time they simply say what rank you are

files.name: Exciting Skill Ranks v2_1
files.changelogHtml:
Fixed several ellipses (...) displaying as unknown characters (due to MS Word's knack of converting them to a special character)
Modified the main script to use GetBaseActorValue instead of GetActorValue so that temporary buffs will not trigger a new rank

files.name: Exciting Skill Ranks v3_0
files.changelogHtml:
Added 18 new messages, one for each skill, that you'll only see when achieving Master rank on Legendary skills AND IF YOU HAVE SKSE - yes, I know most people will never get there, but when you do, you'll appreciate it! Hopefully.
Updated script to give you messages again after making a skill Legendary, making this mod enjoyable for much longer
Refactored a lot of code to make things cleaner, because returning to code I wrote 2 years ago was giving me a headache
This mod now adds around 4,000 words across all 90 messages (5 unique messages per skill), so no matter what your character build or playstyle is, there will be messages for you to enjoy!

files.name: Exciting Skill Ranks v3_1
files.changelogHtml:
Added "compatibility" for the Community Uncapper mod (it was already compatible; I just made Legendary messages appear at level 200)
Introduced the SkyRe version - only have one ESP enabled at once

files.name: Exciting Skill Ranks v3_1 SkyRe Version
files.fileName: Exciting Skill Ranks v3_1 SkyRe Version-27588-3-1.zip
files.changelogHtml:
Added "compatibility" for the Community Uncapper mod (it was already compatible; I just made Legendary messages appear at level 200)
Introduced the SkyRe version - only have one ESP enabled at once
